Taxon name.Name: Rhodococcus rhodochrous
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Rhodococcus rhodochrous (Zopf 1891) Tsukamura 1974 (Approved Lists 1980) emend. Rainey et al. 1995 emend. Nouioui et al. 2018 MB# 
Taxonomic synonyms: Rhodococcus roseus (ex Grotenfelt 1889) Tsukamura et al. 1991 MB#

Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: documents providing proof of legal access and terms of use available at the collection
Isolator: Oil-polluted water, oilfield, Perm region, Russia
Metabolites production: Transforms drotaverine to 3,4-diethoxybenzoic acid, 3,4-diethoxybenzaldehyde and 3,4-diethoxybenzoic acid ethyl ester; transforms thioanisole to methyl phenyl sulfoxide.
Applications: Forms cholesterol oxidase; transforms thioanisole, accumulates molybdenum and nickel; drotaverine hydrochloride-resistant; adheres to liquid hydrocarbons (n-hexadecane); resistant to n-decane, 1-butanol, ethanol; degrades meloxicam; resistant to Cr6+ (5.0 mM), VO2+ (12.5 mM), VO43- (50.0 mM), VO3- (250.0 mM).
